content.question: The photoelectron spectrum for the element boron is represented above. Which of the following best explains how the spectrum is consistent with the electron shell model of the atom?

choices.label: The spectrum shows an odd number electrons.
The spectrum shows a single electron in the <math alttext="2 p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> subshell.
The spectrum shows equal numbers of electrons in the first and second electron shells.
The spectrum shows three electrons with the same binding energy in the second electron shell.

content.answer: The spectrum shows a single electron in the <math alttext="2 p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> subshell.

skill.text: 4.B: Explain whether a model is consistent with chemical theories.
